function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"High-risk environment in public transport","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Historical lack of adoption of infection-fighting solutions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of historical pandemics on urban design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adaptation of historical structures for new roles","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Extended urbanisation and informal public areas increase vulnerability to infectious diseases due to demographic factors, infrastructure, and governance.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Built environment can create conditions for the spread of specific diseases, such as legionnaire’s disease, through factors like air conditioning, indoor plumbing, and hot water systems.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical pandemic diseases have been influenced by the built environment, with measures such as quarantine, infrastructure improvements, and urban planning playing a role in disease management.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of infectious diseases in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated water supply leading to disease outbreak","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor sanitation and sewage management leading to disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sunlight and ventilation in buildings contributing to the spread of tuberculosis","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor city planning and sanitation leading to rapid spread of plague and cholera","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Miasma theory leading to ineffective disease prevention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misunderstanding of disease transmission routes leading to ineffective containment measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spread of gastrointestinal problems and fevers associated with infectious diseases such as dysentery or typhoid among the legions or in military camps.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Outbreaks of the bubonic plague devastating europe in the mid-fourteenth century, causing the death of millions of people.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of the bubonic plague through trade routes, mainly via fleas carried by rats and other infected animals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with the potential failure of solutions to reduce covid-19 risks over time","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks of inadequate solutions leading to ongoing covid-19 transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks of overlooking broader sustainability in the pursuit of covid-19 risk reduction","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations and deficiencies of buildings in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential temporary changes to the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sustainability in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination by covid-19 and other fresh outbreaks of the virus","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Deficiencies of buildings and the built environment revealed during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on built environment in covid-19 research","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of sustainable development in disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focus on behavioral controls over structural changes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Globalization leading to increased movement of people and goods, and rapid dissemination of ideas, increasing the potential for transmission of infectious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization altering the consequences of infectious diseases, with cities creating conditions for the growth and spread of new microorganisms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited focus on the built environment in covid-19 research and publications, with less than 1% of articles addressing the impact on buildings and built environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global spread of infectious diseases like covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear efficacy of protection against re-infections in people with and without symptoms at their initial sars-cov-2 infection","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Accumulating evidence on the efficacy and duration of natural immunity contributing to the mitigation of the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete vaccination data due to vaccinations taking place outside of the health system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lower testing frequency in previously sars-cov-2 infected participants versus the control group","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Seroprevalence surveys suggesting higher infection rates than reported sars-cov-2 cases","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Difficulty for operators in the adoption of technology due to limitations of the model","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data collected during the initial testing period may be affected by the learning phase of individuals","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Expansion to a drive-through environment introduces new time measures and operational differences","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Addition of new smartphones to digitalize a larger clinic introduces scalability and data management challenges.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mass vaccination process against covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High efficiency of the vaccination process","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of smartphone application with nfc technology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long queue at the beginning of the day in the inoculation phase","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased flow of patients leading to crowded moments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High utilization of doctors in the anamnesis control phase","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Queues before and after inoculation phase could lead to potential overcrowding and spread of contagious diseases in the waiting area.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mean and maximum values of the queue indicate higher patient congestion after inoculation, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Constant wait time of 15 minutes for post-inoculation waiting may result in patients being in close proximity for an extended period, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
